title: Toy-data workflows
text: Many methods implemented optional backends (GitHub/Bioconductor packages, bundled scripts). Check can run machine: need optional backend (unavailable ), install via: need t library installing. Note MOM-SS/BFR.. support MOM-SS “BFR.” backend right now. want run method mentioned paper, eg. Laplace-SS, please refer original repository. Note SUFA. need install PROJ, sqlite3 GDAL onto PATH. Several updates done, example, terra. might difficult. Note BMSFA install_backend(“bmsfa”) installs MSFA package Mavis’s GitHub, allows user-input scaling centering options. DeVito MSFA package options internal standardizations. backend DeVito’s MSFA, specify scaling/centering. Note script backends (PFA / Tetris). package, PFA Tetris bundled inst/extdata/pfa/ inst/extdata/tetris/. loaded demand via load_backend("pfa") load_backend("tetris"). PFA may compile PFA.cpp, requires working C++ toolchain. install_backend function work, can always install run bmfaToolkits package.
code: # install.packages("remotes") # remotes::install_local("path/to/bmfaToolkits")  # or install from your repo library(bmfaToolkits) available_backends() install_backend("bmsfa")        # installs MSFA from GitHub install_backend("momss")        # installs BFR.BE + Bioc deps install_backend("sufa")         # installs SUFA from GitHub (build_vignettes = FALSE) install_backend("curated_ovarian")

what: 1. Load toy data (shipped in the package)
title: Toy-data workflows
text: demonstrate workflows using toy simulated data S = 3 studies P = 20 variables. toy data live inst/extdata/toy.rds. can load using system.file(). package wrappers expect Y_list: list study matrices number columns (variables). Throughout vignette: - S = number studies - P = number variables
code: toy <- readRDS(system.file("extdata", "toy.rds", package = "bmfaToolkits", mustWork = TRUE)) str(toy, max.level = 2) Y_list <- toy$Y_list S <- length(Y_list) P <- ncol(Y_list[[1]]) c(S = S, P = P)

title: Toy-data workflows
text: postprocess_*() function returns list covariance components used tutorial: Phi / SigmaPhi: shared loadings / shared covariance LambdaList / SigmaLambdaList: study-specific loadings / covariances (method ) Psi PsiList: diagonal residual variances SigmaMarginal: per-study marginal covariance (shared + specific + residual) selection helpers choose dimensions using eigenvalue proportion rule (see select_k_from_sigma()), refit_*() helpers wrap “initial fit → select dims → refit” workflow.

title: Toy-data workflows
text: “Stack FA” stacks studies fits single factor model.

title: Toy-data workflows
code: fit0 <- fit_stack_fa(   Y_list = Y_list,   k = 5, # Overspecified   centering = TRUE,   scaling = FALSE,   control = list(nrun = 1000, burn = 200) )

title: Toy-data workflows
text: postprocess_stack_fa() takes S can return per-study list SigmaMarginal.
code: post0 <- postprocess_stack_fa(fit0, S = S) names(post0)

title: Toy-data workflows
code: select_k_stack_fa(post0, cutoff = 0.05)  out <- fit_stack_fa_2step(   Y_list = Y_list,   post_fit0 = post0,   cutoff = 0.05,   control = list(nrun = 1000, burn = 200) )

what: A4. Fit two-step Stack FA in one call
title: Toy-data workflows
code: out <- fit_stack_fa_2step(   Y_list = Y_list,   k = 4,# Overspecified   control = list(nrun = 1000, burn = 200)   )

title: Toy-data workflows
text: “Ind FA” fits separate factor models per study.

title: Toy-data workflows
text: specify j_s either: - single integer (recycled studies), - length-S integer vector.
code: fit0 <- fit_ind_fa(   Y_list = Y_list,   j_s = rep(3, S),   centering = TRUE,   scaling = FALSE,   control = list(nrun = 1000, burn = 200) )

title: Toy-data workflows
code: post0 <- postprocess_ind_fa(fit0) select_js_ind_fa(post0, cutoff = 0.05)  out <- fit_ind_fa_2step(   Y_list = Y_list,   post_fit0 = post0,   cutoff = 0.05,   control = list(nrun = 1000, burn = 200) )

what: B3. Fit two-step Ind FA in one call
title: Toy-data workflows
code: out <- fit_ind_fa_2step(   Y_list = Y_list,   j_s = rep(3, S),   centering = TRUE,   scaling = FALSE,   control = list(nrun = 1000, burn = 200) )

title: Toy-data workflows
text: PFA scripts bundled inst/extdata/pfa/. wrapper: 1) loads backend via load_backend("pfa") 2) centers/scales study (defaults center=TRUE, scale=FALSE) 3) stacks one matrix X builds study id vector b 4) calls backend PFA(X = X, b = b, k = ..., ...)

title: Toy-data workflows
code: fit <- fit_pfa(   Y_list = Y_list,   k = 6, # Overspecified   center = TRUE,   scale = FALSE,   nrun = 1000,   burn = 500   # other backend parameters via ... )

title: Toy-data workflows
code: post <- postprocess_pfa(fit) select_k_pfa(post)

title: Toy-data workflows
text: MOM-SS uses BFR.backend requires: - q (aka k): number shared factors - optional covariates X (passed backend v) package wrapper, pass Y_list, wrapper stacks x, builds membership matrix b, forwards q v.

title: Toy-data workflows
text: X can either: - single matrix sum(nrow(Y_list)) rows, - list matrices aligned Y_list (stacked). Example: two synthetic covariates per subject:
code: X_list <- lapply(Y_list, function(Y) {   n <- nrow(Y)   cbind(x1 = rnorm(n), x2 = rnorm(n)) })

title: Toy-data workflows
code: fit <- fit_momss(   Y_list = Y_list,   k = 6,         X = X_list, # optional   scaling = FALSE ) post <- postprocess_momss(fit)  names(post) # post$SigmaPhi, post$Psi, post$alpha, post$B, post$SigmaMarginal

title: Toy-data workflows
text: tutorial workflow, typically: - center within study (center = TRUE) - rescale variances (scale = FALSE) - specify qmax nrun

title: Toy-data workflows
code: #install_backend("sufa") fit <- fit_sufa(   Y_list = Y_list,   k = 6,      # or kmax = 6 depending on your wrapper   nrun = 1000,   center = TRUE,   scale = FALSE ) post <- postprocess_sufa(fit)   names(post)

title: Toy-data workflows
text: specify: - k: number shared factors - j_s: number study-specific factors (length S) can control MCMC via control = list(nrun = ..., burn = ...).
code: fit0 <- fit_bmsfa(   Y_list = Y_list,   k = 5, # Overspecified   j_s = rep(2, S),   centering = TRUE,   scaling = FALSE,   control = list(nrun = 2000, burn = 1000) )

title: Toy-data workflows
code: post0 <- postprocess_bmsfa(fit0)  names(post0)

title: Toy-data workflows
code: select_k_bmsfa(post0, cutoff = 0.05) select_js_bmsfa(post0, cutoff = 0.05)  # refit out <- fit_bmsfa_2step(   Y_list = Y_list,   post_fit0 = post0,   cutoff = 0.05,   control = list(nrun = 1000, burn = 200) ) # Or `fit_bmsfa` with the selected k and j_s, and `postprocess` again.

what: F4. Fit two-step BMSFA in one call
title: Toy-data workflows
code: out <- fit_bmsfa_2step(   Y_list = Y_list,   k = 5, # Overspecified   j_s = rep(2, S),   centering = TRUE,   scaling = FALSE,   control = list(nrun = 1000, burn = 200) )

title: Toy-data workflows
text: CAVI variational inference algorithm multi-study factor analysis implemented GitHub repo blhansen/VI-MSFA (R package name: VIMSFA). need - Y_list: list S matrices, n_s × P, studies share variables (P column order). - k (K VI-MSFA): number common factors. - j_s (J_s VI-MSFA): study-specific factor counts (either scalar length-S vector). - Preprocessing: project typically centers (center=TRUE, scale=FALSE) match methods. postprocess_cavi() behind scenes VIMSFA::cavi_msfa() returns posterior means: - mean_phi (P × K): common loading matrix Φ - mean_lambda_s (list P × J_s): study-specific loading matrices Λ_s - mean_psi_s (list length-P): residual variances ψ_s bmfaToolkits::post_CAVI()/postprocess_cavi() converts standardized outputs used throughout package: - SigmaPhi = Φ Φᵀ - SigmaLambdaList[[s]] = Λ_s Λ_sᵀ - SigmaMarginal[[s]] = SigmaPhi + SigmaLambdaList[[s]] + diag(ψ_s)
code: # install the backend once (downloads / installs VIMSFA from GitHub) bmfaToolkits::install_backend("cavi")  Y_list <- toy$Y_list  fit_cavi <- bmfaToolkits::fit_cavi(   Y_list = Y_list,   k      = 3,                 # common factors   j_s    = 2,                 # study-specific factors (scalar -> recycled to length S)   centering = TRUE,   scaling   = FALSE )  post_cavi <- bmfaToolkits::postprocess_cavi(fit_cavi) str(post_cavi, max.level = 1)

title: Toy-data workflows
text: Like BMSFA package, CAVI can run 2-step workflow: Fit initial (often -specified) model (k, j_s). Post-process get SigmaPhi SigmaLambda_s. Select K J_s using eigen-proportion rule (cutoff). Refit selected factor counts.
code: # Step 1: initial fit (choose generous k / j_s) fit0  <- bmfaToolkits::fit_cavi(Y_list, k = 8, j_s = 6, centering = TRUE, scaling = FALSE) post0 <- bmfaToolkits::postprocess_cavi(fit0)  # Step 2: refit using selected K and J_s post2 <- bmfaToolkits::refit_cavi(Y_list, post_fit0 = post0, cutoff = 0.05,                                   centering = TRUE, scaling = FALSE)  # Or: do both in one call post2_alt <- bmfaToolkits::fit_cavi_2step(Y_list, k = 8, j_s = 6, cutoff = 0.05,                                          centering = TRUE, scaling = FALSE)

title: Toy-data workflows
text: BLAST implemented research-code repository (CRAN/Bioconductor package) : maurilorenzo/BLAST. package treat BLAST script backend (like PFA/Tetris): developing source: put BLAST scripts inst/extdata/blast/. installation: available system.file("extdata","blast", package="bmfaToolkits"). fit_blast() loads scripts via load_backend("blast"). need - Y_list: list S matrices, n_s × P (P across studies). - k: number common factors. - q_s: study-specific factor counts (scalar length S). - Important BLAST args project: - n_MC: Monte Carlo iterations (e.g., 10000). - sample_outer_product: FALSE, BLAST requires subsample_index (default 1:min(100, P)). postprocess_blast() behind scenes BLAST’s fit object list whose fields may vary depending settings. bmfaToolkits::post_BLAST() attempts extract: - Lambda_mean (P × K) Phi - Lambda_outer_mean (P × P) SigmaPhi present; otherwise compute Phi Phiᵀ - Gammas_mean (P × q × S) /Gammas_outer_mean (P × P × S) study-specific components - Sigma_2s_samples (N_mc × P) residual variances (ψ); absent, residual variances returned NA returns standardized pieces (Phi, SigmaPhi, LambdaList, SigmaLambdaList, PsiList, SigmaMarginal) BLAST can plug downstream code methods.
code: Y_list <- toy$Y_list  fit_blast <- bmfaToolkits::fit_blast(   Y_list = Y_list,   k      = 3,   q_s    = 1,   n_MC   = 10000,   center = TRUE,   scale  = FALSE,   sample_outer_product = FALSE   # subsample_index defaults to 1:min(100, P) when sample_outer_product = FALSE )  post_blast <- bmfaToolkits::postprocess_blast(fit_blast) str(post_blast, max.level = 1)

title: Toy-data workflows
text: Tetris scripts bundled inst/extdata/tetris/. “3-step” workflow tutorial : initial run: tetris(..., fixed_bigT = FALSE) select big_T: choose.(fit, alpha_IBP = alpha, S = S) fixed run: tetris(..., fixed_bigT = TRUE, bigT = big_T)

title: Toy-data workflows
code: fit1 <- fit_tetris(Y_list, alpha = "auto", beta = 1, fixed_bigT = FALSE, nrun = 500, burn = 200, nprint = 100) # Reduced iterations a faster runtime big_T <- select_T_tetris(fit1)  # passes alpha_IBP and S from fit1 metadata by default fit2 <- fit_tetris(Y_list, alpha = fit1$meta$alpha, beta = 1, fixed_bigT = TRUE, bigT = big_T,                    nrun = 500, burn = 200, nprint = 100) out <- postprocess_tetris(fit2)

title: Toy-data workflows
code: out <- fit_tetris_2step(   Y_list = Y_list,   alpha = "auto",   # ceiling(1.25 * S)   beta = 1,   nrun = 500,   burn = 200,   nprint = 100 )

title: Toy-data workflows
text: fit_integrative_fa(method = "bmsfa"|"momss"|..., ...) postprocess_integrative_fa(method = ..., fit) Example:
code: fit <- fit_integrative_fa("bmsfa", Y_list = Y_list, k = 4, j_s = rep(2, S)) post <- postprocess_integrative_fa("bmsfa", fit)

title: Toy-data workflows
text: function give nice heatmap plot loadings
code: plot_single_loadings(mat = out$Phi, fill_limits = c(-2, 2)) # Displays grey if values are out of range

title: Toy-data workflows
text: Start short runs (nrun/burn) validate pipeline, increase. Always check study P (number columns). methods rotational ambiguity, rely package post-processing (e.g., OP alignment) comparing loadings.

title: Toy-data workflows

title: Fit MOM-SS (MOM-SS / BFR.BE backend) — fit_momss

title: Fit MOM-SS (MOM-SS / BFR.BE backend) — fit_momss
text: Y_list Optional list study matrices. provided, create stacked matrix. k Positive integer number shared factors. X Optional covariate matrix list covariate matrices aligned Y_list. scaling Logical; whether scale data. center_within_study Logical; whether center study's data fitting. Recommended unless strong reasons . folds Number folds cross-validation within MOM-SS. ... Parameters can pass directly BFR.::BFR..EM.CV().

title: Fit MOM-SS (MOM-SS / BFR.BE backend) — fit_momss

title: Fit Tetris (single run) — fit_tetris
text: Runs one Tetris fit. Optionally uses fixed matrix (selected choose.()).

title: Fit Tetris (single run) — fit_tetris
code: fit_tetris(   Y_list,   alpha = c("auto"),   beta = 1,   fixed_bigT = FALSE,   bigT = NULL,   nrun = 3000,   burn = 2000,   nprint = 200,   ... )

title: Fit Tetris (single run) — fit_tetris
text: Y_list List study matrices. alpha Either numeric alpha, "auto" use ceiling(1.25 * S). beta Beta hyperparameter Tetris. fixed_bigT Logical; whether run fixed big T. bigT Fixed T matrix used fixed=TRUE. nrun Number iterations. burn Burn-iterations. nprint Print frequency. ... Passed backend tetris().

title: Fit Tetris (single run) — fit_tetris
text: bifa_fit object.

what: Run the full Tetris pipeline: initial fit -> choose T -> fixed refit — fit_tetris_2step
title: Run the full Tetris pipeline: initial fit -> choose T -> fixed refit — fit_tetris_2step
text: Mirrors common workflow: tetris(..., fixed_bigT=FALSE) big_T <- choose.(fit, ...) tetris(..., fixed_bigT=TRUE, A_fixed=big_T)

title: Run the full Tetris pipeline: initial fit -> choose T -> fixed refit — fit_tetris_2step
code: fit_tetris_2step(   Y_list,   alpha = "auto",   beta = 1,   nrun = 3000,   burn = 2000,   nprint = 200,   chooseA_args = list(),   ... )

title: Run the full Tetris pipeline: initial fit -> choose T -> fixed refit — fit_tetris_2step
text: Y_list List study matrices. alpha Either numeric alpha, "auto" use ceiling(1.25 * S). beta Beta hyperparameter. nrun, burn, nprint MCMC controls runs. chooseA_args List extra arguments passed choose.(). ... Extra args passed tetris() runs.

title: Run the full Tetris pipeline: initial fit -> choose T -> fixed refit — fit_tetris_2step
text: bifa_fit (fixed refit) stage1 big_T attached.

what: Plot a loading matrix as a heatmap — plot_single_loadings
title: Plot a loading matrix as a heatmap — plot_single_loadings
text: Creates ggplot2 heatmap (tile plot) numeric loading matrix, optional custom y-axis labeling optional colorbar.

title: Plot a loading matrix as a heatmap — plot_single_loadings
code: plot_single_loadings(   mat,   y_label = NULL,   fill_limits = c(-1.3, 1.5),   show_colorbar = FALSE )

title: Plot a loading matrix as a heatmap — plot_single_loadings
text: mat Numeric matrix. Loading matrix plot. y_label Optional character vector row labels (length = nrow(mat)). provided, y-axis ticks correspond row indices labels set y_label. fill_limits Numeric length-2 vector giving limits diverging color scale. Use limits across plots make comparable. show_colorbar Logical; whether display colorbar legend.

title: Plot a loading matrix as a heatmap — plot_single_loadings
text: ggplot object.

title: Post-process BMSFA output — postprocess_bmsfa
text: OP Phi Lambda_s, form SigmaPhi, SigmaLambdaList, estimate Psi_s averaging fit$psi[[s]] iterations, build marginal covariance SigmaPhi + SigmaLambda_s + diag(Psi_s).

title: Post-process BMSFA output — postprocess_bmsfa
text: list Phi, SigmaPhi, LambdaList, SigmaLambdaList, PsiList, SigmaMarginal.

what: Post-process Stack FA output (nutrition tutorial) — postprocess_stack_fa
title: Post-process Stack FA output (nutrition tutorial) — postprocess_stack_fa
text: Implements post-processing nutrition case study: apply orthogonal Procrustes (OP) posterior loadings, form SigmaPhi = Phi Phi^T, estimate marginal covariance averaging Sigma draws, estimate Psi averaging Sigma - Lambda Lambda^T MCMC iterations.

title: Post-process Stack FA output (nutrition tutorial) — postprocess_stack_fa
code: postprocess_stack_fa(fit, S)

title: Post-process Stack FA output (nutrition tutorial) — postprocess_stack_fa
text: fit bifa_fit object fit_stack_fa() raw MSFA::sp_fa() fit. S Number studies (used replicate marginal covariance list).

title: Post-process Stack FA output (nutrition tutorial) — postprocess_stack_fa
text: list Phi, SigmaPhi, Psi, SigmaMarginal.

title: Post-process Tetris output — postprocess_tetris
text: tutorial extracts study-specific loadings via getLambda(fit) Tetris script builds marginal covariances Lambda Lambda^T + Psi.

title: Post-process Tetris output — postprocess_tetris
code: postprocess_tetris(fit, num_samps = NULL)

title: Post-process Tetris output — postprocess_tetris
text: fit bifa_fit fit_tetris() raw Tetris fit. num_samps Number posterior samples use. NULL, uses min(2000, available).

title: Post-process Tetris output — postprocess_tetris
text: list Phi, SigmaPhi, LambdaList, SigmaLambdaList, PsiList, SigmaMarginal.

what: Refit CAVI after selecting the number of factors — refit_cavi
title: Refit CAVI after selecting the number of factors — refit_cavi
text: Implements 2-step workflow: fit initial CAVI model, post-process obtain covariance components, select factor counts using eigen-proportion rule, refit CAVI selected K J_s.

title: Refit CAVI after selecting the number of factors — refit_cavi
code: refit_cavi(Y_list, fit0 = NULL, post_fit0 = NULL, cutoff = 0.05, ...)

title: Refit CAVI after selecting the number of factors — refit_cavi
text: Y_list List S study matrices (n_s x P). fit0 Optional initial fit fit_cavi(). post_fit0 Optional post-processed initial fit postprocess_cavi(). fit0 post_fit0 supplied, post_fit0 used. cutoff Eigen-proportion cutoff passed select_k_from_sigma(). ... Passed fit_cavi() refit.

title: Refit CAVI after selecting the number of factors — refit_cavi
text: Post-processed output refit (structure postprocess_cavi()).
